Reviews.Title: “Andaz San Diego is a must see!”
Reviews.Author: Erica C
Reviews.Content: From the time my husband and I arrived at the Andaz, we were treated like special guests. Upon check in, we were greeted by a guy named Mike who hooked us up right when we got there by ordering us drinks and giving us great recommendations. I have never had such a good experience with customer service as I did when we stayed tere. This hotel is really nice and modern and I felt right at home from the time we stepped foot in the lobby! It set the mood for our whole stay. I would definitley stay at this hotel and look for Mike when you get there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at Andaz San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Salim K
Reviews.Content: Was in San Diego for a business trip and got to stay at Andaz.Simply amazing when it comes to ambience, the hosts in there and just feels like a home away from home...A definite recommendation to someone who would be visiting the city for a good and a comfortable stay...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in SD”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: I do not usually write reviews, but for Andaz i had to. I have brought my Wife to this amazing hotel on a few different special nights. Not only is the hotel sophisticated but the staff makes it an automatic 5 Stars!!!!! Upon arrival they make you feel like family, greeted with a glass of wine/juice/water, they quickly check you in on their tablet. Once you get to the room you will not be disappointed. These rooms are awesome! Don't forget to visit the rooftop bar and pool, the view is fantastic and the drinks are strong. A personal thank you to our host Michael Barbary, you were the best and most helpful concierge i have ever had. I can tell you we will be back!!!! Thanks Andaz

Reviews.Title: “Chic”
Reviews.Author: socalfam
Reviews.Content: Cool pool area! Tiny pool. Tiny rooms. Valet Prkng will set you back $35

Reviews.Title: “Andaz - San Deigo - June 2011”
Reviews.Author: Deanna W
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m happy to say that I found most everything about my first experience with an Andaz hotel to be very positive! The hotel staff was courteous and attentive. The room was extremely clean. The contemporary decor was both fun and relaxing. The location of the property was just what we wanted, near enough to the main action of the Gas Lamp district, while still being slightly off, the more heavily populated area. We took advantage of room service for breakfast daily and for dinner multiple times. The food was very good and delivered extremely quickly. It was however quite pricey (as is to be expected- as room service always is). The complimentary snacks and drinks in the minibar were a nice touch. Complimentary internet access was also a nice feature. I booked our room on-line and was taking advantage of corporate rate program. There was a discrepancy with our confirmed room rate, but upon showing my confirmation, it was corrected without question. I usually utilize the hotel concierge for recommendations and reservations. At the Andaz, there was not a formal concierge but everyone I spoke with was more than willing and able to make our stay at the hotel and the city a wonderful birthday weekend. Instead of having access to one person to assist us with special arrangements, we seemingly had an entire staff who were ready to take care of our needs. We will certianly consider this property when we go back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off”
Reviews.Author: steve j
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but they charged an extra 450.00 on my credit card and were not helpful when i called them about it. Scary part they said i presented a card for the items,,,never did

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and sophisticated in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Cupcakedujour
Reviews.Content: The Andaz hotel is a sleek, cosmopolitan hotel, in the heart of San Diego's trendy Gaslamp district. It will appeal to those with high end taste, seeking to stay somewhere with style. Â  The hotel's simplistic and modern decor, free of clutter and excess, was noticeable throughout the venue, but was particularly effective in the rooms. Â  Our room was petite, but the lay-out and design were so well done, that it never felt claustrophobic. Â The use of aÂ glass partition between the queen sized bed and basin helped to keep the room from feeling positively tiny, but the lack of a proper wall meant that washing up took place in full display of the rest of the room. Â Full privacy was limited to the shower and toilet area only, and for this reason, I would suggest this room is best suited toÂ singletons, or those who do not mind sharing the minutiae of their daily and nightly grooming rituals. We spent just one night in this sophisticated boutique hotel, and with the whirlwind of events that followed, I nearly forgot to mention my stay... However, I must point out that this in no way reflects a lack of quality, or lessens the impact this terrific hotel Â had upon me. Â The front desk team, and staff of the Andaz displayed a high level of competence and care, and I felt very well attended to during my brief stay. Â  I would be happy to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world- like all Andaz properties”
Reviews.Author: sydneyberlin
Reviews.Content: I usually am not easy to please but very much like the sister property in West Hollywood, there isn't much to complain at all: Lovely old renovated buidking with funky artwork everywhere, super attentive staff and nice posh room with comfy bed, lovely shower and bathroom and simply everything you could wish for. Wifi is free and fast, soft drinks from the mini bar are also complimentary. Roof top pool is lovely and so are the other facilities. Service like in all Andaz I've stayed before is like it should be: You dial "Host" an the phone gets picked up instantly and what ever you want gets done. Very different to the "WhateverWhenever" hold line the Ws offer you these days. Only grief with this particular property is that it's in a horrid area of town, one of those historic quarters that are now a mix of tourist trap and redneck bar hangout. I stayed during the week and got a room on the highest floor and still heard drunk idiots yelling and loud music from the bars all night. Other than that, all lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChanelCurrey
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough great things about our stay at this hotel! All the employees are extremely helpful, especially Mike who made us feel welcomed and right at home! Great rooms, decor and the rooftop night club is a great in house addition to an already amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with friendly staff and nice extras.”
Reviews.Author: coco057toronto
Reviews.Content: The Andaz is a modern, well-renovated hotel with very friendly staff. Upon arrival, one is greated by attractive, smiling young staff who immediately offer you a beverage before they check you in on their iPads. They are consistently helpful, always open the door and are at your disposal for everything. The rooms are a good size and very comfortable with big flat screen TVs, a good desk area and there is free wifi throughout the hotel. The fridg is stocked with juices, pop, sparkling and still water that are complimentary. There is also a basket with artisanal chips, a granola bar and Toblerone bar that are complimentary and replenished. There is a roof top pool and apparently a club, which I did not venture to, as the unusually chilly weather did not encourage the former and my age did not result in my frequenting the latter. I was told by the check-in staff (which I thought was very open-minded of them, given my age group in the 50's) that there were 2 clubs, I believe one of which is a wine bar and that I would have a wrist band with free access to these areas if I so desired! There is an excellent sushi/Japanese restaurant in the lobby, Katsuya, which will do take out so that one can enjoy dinner in the room. There is complimentary wine in the lobby from 6 to 8 and always a changing array of fresh fruit in a large bowl at the small business centre in the lobby. I ordered room service breakfast once and it was delivered promptly at the requested time. This is a hotel with a heart, and I truly enjoyed my stay. It is located in the "Historic Gas Lamp District" with many nearby restaurants and in close proximity to the Convention Centre. It is also close to the San Diego trolley system which takes you to many locations, for a $5 a day pass. The desk staff suggested I take it rather than a $25 to $30 cab fare to the outlying Fashion Valley mall. My only criticism is that due to the fact that it is a hip place, with an active night scene, it was a little noisy at night over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster Hotel in the heart of the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: sdsurfergirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hip and modern Andaz for a "staycation" for our 6th wedding anniversary. We chose the Andaz because it is right across the street from the new American Comedy Club that we were seeing a show at. We had a standard queen room that comes stocked with snacks and mini-fridge beverages - many of the drinks and snacks were complimentary to our surprise. The room was very comfortable and nice, but I did not like the lack of privacy in the bathroom. The sink area is enclosed in clear glass and the toilet and shower were only separated by frosted glass and a door with no lock. The cool thing about the room is the surround sound speakers for the TV. You could listen to the TV from the bathroom and the sound was like a movie theatre. The rooftop was definitely a scene with mostly young attractive couples or singles getting some sun before a night of night clubbing. This is definitely not a hotel for families or folks that want to hang around in jean shorts and tennis shoes. You will feel under dressed at night if you arenâ€™t decked out in club attire for the nightclub that pretty much consumes the hotel at night . We were the only people wearing jeans when we returned from the Comedy club around 10PM. The lobby had turned into a "velvet rope" entrance to the night club. We had to get a special bracelet for hotel guest so we could get passed the bouncers and roam "freely" around the hotel. We enjoyed some people watching from the wine bar - the automated wine dispensers are the best invention ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great One Night Gettaway”
Reviews.Author: Matthew C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Andaz in early February of this year. My new girlfriend and I were looking for a place to get away from our jobs/school for a night. I wanted something a bit upscale to impress her, so I decided to go with Andaz and I was extremely pleased with my experience. The customer service was incredible, I felt like I was being treated like a celebrity the whole time. Thanks to all of the staff, but my special regards goes to Mr. Michael Barbary. Not only was I greeted upon arrival, but he made me feel expected, honored, in a sense, for me to be visiting the hotel. His service was impeccable, especially when he took my shirt and had it pressed and delivered to my room before an we were driven 1 block to the restaurant for dinner. Room was great, the area is perfect for nightlife, and all in all was a great choice. Thanks Andaz, and thank you Mr. Barbary!

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop lunch”
Reviews.Author: SSGCt
Reviews.Content: While walking the gas lamp district we decided to have lunch at the rooftop. The food was great and we enjoyed the view. The hotel looks like a great place to stay for or next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small but location is great, right in the heart of gaslamp district”
Reviews.Author: superduperang
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Andaz from February 19-22 when I visited San Diego with my friend during our California vacation. We had prebooked a double room in December and got a confirmation, only to be disappointed when they downgraded us to a single queen bed room when we arrived. They made the excuse that they were overbooked that weekend, but I thought since we booked so far ahead we should've gotten the room we wanted. In any case, the queen room was super small (it felt too cramped for 2 girls) and the bed was pretty standard. The bathroom was designed kind of awkwardly, since I could basically watch my friend through the glass between the sink and the bed. I did have a major issue with the shower-- I don't know if they did it on purpose for a design element, but I HATED the showerhead. The placement of where to put the shower arm was so inconvenient (and I am only making a fuss because I kept getting soap in my eye since I was too short to reach the shower head and had to hold it the whole time while trying to shampoo, so annoying!!!!) I do have to give the hotel some stars: the service was attentive especially when I asked them to get my car charger from our rental car, they knew just where to look. Also the location is excellent and super convenient, right in the heart of the gaslamp district and close to all the shops and restaurants, that deserves a star in itself. I only wish we stayed during the days when the rooftop bar was open. But, it was nice to have breakfast there and it was delicious. I'd stay here again but would make sure I book a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was top notch”
Reviews.Author: Skinmakeuppro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited the Andaz San Diego for a weekend staycation. The customer service at this modern boutique hotel was absolutely the best thing about it, not to say that there was really anything bad about it. From the moment you walk in the door, the staff does everything possible to make you feel like you are the only person in the room. They offer you refreshments as you are waiting for your room and make sure that you know everything the hotel has to offer. We arrived before our room was ready, so they stored our luggage and took our information so they could contact us when our room was ready. The room we requested was not available (a king bed) so they offered us a queen and, for the trouble, brought up a bottle of wine and cheese plate. The rooms are not very big, again not a big deal to us, but they are modern in their decor, beds are very comfortable and have plenty little extras (refreshments) to make up for the size. The bad - lots of noise at night (which is why I gave it very good instead of excellent). 3 nightclubs on the property, I believe. If you are looking for a nice quiet place to get a good nights sleep, this is not it. However, I think most people that stay here are more interested in the night life. I wouldn't suggest this as a family hotel, definitely not a place I'd bring my children. Especially with the "adult toys" available, for a fee, in your room between the jelly beans and M and M's. Think of it kind of like Las Vegas in the middle of San Diego. Overall, a great place for a couple to get away, a girls weekend or to be in the middle of all that's going on downtown.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michele J
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here this weekend and all I can say is AMAZING. Michael and Tom definitely know the meaning of excellent customer service. They answered all of our questions, recommended some amazing restaurants...thank you Michael. Tom made our check-in smooth. After driving for 3 hours, to arrive at the hotel and they greet you at the door with their iPads....very nice. They even offer you a glass of wine. It was my birthday weekend...and they made me feel very special. I would definitely stay here again. This is a "party" type hotel so it isn't the place to stay with your family or the place to stay if you're trying to relax. I would RECOMMEND this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Boutique Hotel with a Caveat: Partying not Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Christie5679
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting San Diego with your family or for a romantic getaway geared toward relaxation, DO NOT stay at the Andaz. I repeat, this is not the hotel for you! However, if you are in search of some serious nightlife, you will find that the Andaz exceeds all of your expectations. A Hyatt property located in the heart of San Diego's Gas Lamp District, the Andaz is a boutique hotel, with everything that implies: intimacy, luxury, and hospitality. Elegant, attentive staff greet you as you enter the foyer, and are just waiting to assist you throughout your stay. The decor and vibe is very "Cristal," with sumptuous appointments and a contemporary aesthetic. During the day, the Andaz whispers subtle affluence and offers various inviting climes for rendezvous. A rooftop lounge with cosmopolitan views and a chic wine bar with cozy corners are two of the options. At night, the entire hotel transforms into a mecca for dancing, drinking, and dÃ©colletage. The rooftop lounge becomes one of the city's most desirable nightclubs. The wine bar provides plenty of comfortable seating for stiletto-weary ladies, along with a thumping DJ and a full-service bar. Yet, there is more: downstairs, the Ivy Club is currently featuring a "Rio-Carnival" theme, with feathered dancers who gyrate on podiums and staircases, and Capoeira artists who infiltrate the dance floor. For a bachelor/bachelorette party, birthday celebration, or couples getaway, this is THE spot! There will not be much shut-eye, as music from all three clubs can be heard throughout the night into the early hours. But if you want to dance like there's no tomorrow, who needs sleep?!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing service - a fabulous little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: R W
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by the superb check-in service, complete with a lovely glass of wine, and all conducted while we were seated on a comfortable settee in the lobby -- no standing at a front desk! The hotel staff came to us, with an iPad in hand, and took care of everything, from check-in to making a dinner reservation for us. Unbelievable! The room was incredible, too, though we could have used more outlets for all our device chargers. The check-out service was just as easy and prompt and efficient. Again, we did not go to a desk, they walked up to us with an iPad in hand. Wow! The neighborhood is filled with very nice restaurants, bars, etc, all within walking distance, but if you don't want to walk, they will take you and/or pick you up in their private luxury SUV. We will make a point of staying here again, for sure. We travel extensively and this hotel was a wonderful surprise - extraordinary service and an all-round delight.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's hotspot within the Gaslamp Quarter!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: If you like feeling like you're VIP on your trip, then the Andaz is your hotel. Complimentary Escalade...Complimentary Breakfast (if you have AAA)....or $25 room credit for food and beverage (if you have costco)...VIP wristbands for the rooftop party and Ivy nightclub...Complimentary wine when you're checking in to your room...Customer Service oriented staff, who know you by name and provide a concierge service 24/7. Incidentally, Katsuya is opening at this property in the middle of February. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Great - But it's LOUD!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: Perfect beautiful room, very clean and modern, perfect location and the right size. Priced well too.... But - let me be very clear - the endless stream of police cars, ambulances, Harleys, and drunk people carries on all nigh. The only thing missing was garbage trucks turning dumpsters (maybe tonight). Definitely stay here but bring earplugs!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: liztiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Andaz for 4 nights in January. From the pulled up to the curb to when we pulled away for the last time, the service was great. Very friendly and helpful throught out our stay. Our room was great. Very trendy and comfortable. The area is very busy at night. Lots of resturants, bars and clubs within a couple of blocks. For us "old" people it was a bit much, we would prefer a less rowdy area though it was convenient. Andaz has a first rate night club on the roof. Luckily the young woman that checked us in put us in a room that was not under the club so we were not disturbed by that scene. Very intuitive and smart on her part. We would stay at another Andaz for sure though we might consider a more serene location for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelR00k
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull up to the Andaz you are treated very well. The staff has Ipads that check you in and offer complimentary wine or drinks upon checking in. There is a fabulous aroma when walking in and throughout the hotel. The staff is super attentive. The rooms are a tad small , but are very modern and immaculate. They have a restaurant, wine bar, club and 24 hour room service. There are also snacks and sodas that are complimentary in the room. This is not a hotel for families because of the club inside the hotel. Also the $35 Valet parking is a tad steep. Overall it is a an awesome hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service, Top Notch Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Dan T
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Andaz. I went back because I remembered being comfortable, the hotel being classy and in a perfect location. I arrived late, 10pm and was greeted quickly by the valet. I walked inside and I was greeted warmly and put in a great room. The bed was so comfortable, that I was deep asleep in a matter of minutes. The amenties were top notch, the bathroom a great size with a large shower was just what I needed. This visit I did not use the pool but knew it was there and remembered it was great! I plan on staying back at the Andaz at the end of next month and look forward to some good shut-eye, walking the gas lamp district, and going for a late night swim. I have stayed at other San Diego Hotels like the W, Hyatt, Hilton, and Embassy Suites... this hotel ranks up with the W and above the others. Andaz pulls of the botique type feeling with all the modern amenties business travelers are looking for. I woke up early the next day, my car was waiting, the free coffee was hot, and I was on my way after a great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for nightlife and party weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gerrie M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and at a great location. The wine bar and rooftop lounge/club are a great time. Make no mistake... this hotel would not be good for children on the weekends as it is right in down town and if the outside noise doesn't keep you up, the roof top club will. But for a great adult weekend or girls only weekend, this is the spot to be!! The wait staff was great as always and the hotel is adorable and boutique style. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Hip boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustinaTucson
Reviews.Content: The Andaz Hotel is located in the heart of the Gaslight district in downtown San Diego, and it is in walking distance of great restaurants and other area attractions. The roof top lounge is amazing with city views and dancing lights from the fire pit, and the roof top pool makes another interesting gathering spot. It attracts young singles who are looking to hook up before the week-end. The Wine bar, just off the lobby, is another unique spot to test your tastes from a whole wall of wines on tap. The rooms are remodeled with sleek glass wall baths, and they very unexpected departure from the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa Z
Reviews.Content: Very unique property with lots of "little perks"! The Wine Bar with 88 wines on tap is amazing! The bar, pool and the restaurant on the roof are very cool with great views and good food. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for something more boutique in the downtown San Diego area!

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPHICK
Reviews.Content: Cool spot to hang out. Rooftop pool with bar and food. Everybody knows your name and the check-in and check-out process is painless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gas Lamp location”
Reviews.Author: bodine9
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Gas Lamp quarter. Modern sleek and contemporary. Great get-away with fabulous night life!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service with party hardy in mind.”
Reviews.Author: Dink810
Reviews.Content: Great location but rooms are not kid or family friendly. Def a must go for party goers mthe roof top has a great view and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on Andaz San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MMGq
Reviews.Content: The good: -very nice lobby and checkin area. Complimentary drinks while you are checking in. -nice rooms with cool decor, good shower with great bath products -great rooftop bar with an even better happy hour -room service dinner food is really good (I haven't been too impressed with breakfast room service though) -fully stocked mini bar with several complimentary selections -friendly and good customer service The bad: -very noisy...and I'm not even talking about the nights it turns into a night club. I have been on high floors (they only have six) but the noise from the streets down below is obnoxious. Loud, drunk people at night. Trash trucks early in the morning. -I find the bed and pillows to be very uncomfortable...mixed with the noise factor, it's a horrible nights sleep. -I'm a Diamond member with Hyatt and the rooms they "upgrade" you to don't really feel like an upgrade. They have suites (based on their website pics) and I've never been offered one even once (and I've stayed here at least 10+ times over the last year) even when using a guaranteed suite upgrade. -pool is very small and I wish they had a jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the the Gaslamp district!”
Reviews.Author: BFLOMAN
Reviews.Content: Very stylish but not lacking substance. Service is spot on, rooms are comfortable, & fast Internet through out the hotel. Have lunch at the roof top bar great views and comfortable place. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the place to be if you're looking to party in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: aryanna d
Reviews.Content: I was here last July 4th. I absolutely love this place- it has an upbeat vibe which is great if you're looking to mingle and party. location- in the middle of the gas lamp district with easy access to all the clubs on Broadway and restaurants. Also has a complimentary Escalade that will shuttle you around downtown. staff- very personable and laid back. instead of being dressed in the ugly uniforms that most hotels foist on their employees, the staff here is chic- the girls in black cocktail dresses and the men in black button down shirts and dress pants. instead of the traditional stuffy check in where you stand opposite the check-in clerk with a desk separating you the check in clerks at the Andaz carry laptops and come around the table so you're standing on the same side and they'll engage you in conversation as they give you a rundown of the hotel. the staff is definetely younger (20's & 30's). vibe- like other reviewers have said this place has a party-vibe and is meant for adults. If you're travelling with children this may not be the place for you as it can be noisy in the evening. yes- they will give you wrist bands on weekend evenings so you don't have to pay for rooftop lounge access. restaurants- didn't try any lounge/clubs- make sure you go to the rooftop pool which converts to a club/lounge at night- music is techno, complete with go go dancers dancing on top of the bar. don't bother with the club downstairs which gets really hot & muggy and has bad hip-hop music. rooms- modern, renovated. bathrooms are cool with the glass sink counter top and shower but smallish, recommend upgrading to bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Sleezy hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: trinitym32
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my birthday/new years eve 2012. I was so very excited and looked forward to this stay. This is my review. PROS: The staff was very attentive. They were polite and accommodating. Fun parties. Free water offered anytime at the front desk. Comfortable bed. CONS: Valet was $35!!! The new yearâ€™s party was pretty fun. But there were some annoyances. 1. We rang in the New Year on the rooftop, but there was NO countdown! Whoever the DJ was they should be FIRED! Isnâ€™t the countdown the best part of new years? No one knew the moment just passed by! 2. I waited 15 minutes for the elevator in the â€œbasementâ€� club to go back to our room. The elevator attendant dropped off a full load but would not let us ride up even though it was the â€œfor hotel only guests elevatorâ€�. He made us walk up the stairs to the first floor only to catch the SAME elevator there. So annoying. The Room: 1. We had a tiny king room. The rooms are SMALL. There is not bureau to put your clothes. There was a bench with a couple drawers. Thank god we didnâ€™t stay long. 2. No floor length mirror in the room, not even on the back of the closet door. How am I supposed to see how my outfit looks? The ONLY mirror was in the bathroom over the sink. There was a magnifying mirror, but I could not use it because whoever installed it must have been 6'5", and I am a petite 5'2". The lighting the bathroom was very dim. Bad for bathroom. 3. Clear glass bathroom doors?! Kind of sexy for the shower but not the toilet! I need some privacy there. I would suggest frosting the bathroom door glass, especially since you can see the ENTIRE bathroom from the outside hallway!!! 4. The bathroom sink and shower leaked like sieves! There were giant pools of water all over the floor. 5. There was a refrigerator in the room, but it did not keep anything cold. 6. There is absolutely no sound proofing between the rooms. I could hear full conversations in the adjacent rooms through the walls! 7. No sound proofing in the windows either! All night long there were fire engine sirens right outside. We were on the 6th floor. Granted it was NYE, but it sounded like it was IN my room. One word to describe this hotel is sleazy. Lipstick on a pig is still a pig. I will not be staying at the Andaz San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Gaslight”
Reviews.Author: Marblegirl40
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in San Diego! Wonderful staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or Nightclub?”
Reviews.Author: wideworldtravels
Reviews.Content: We have been staying the last 4 nights and now our last night (Fri) we were treated like 3rd class citizens. The security is all over the hotel and guests are asked to get wrist bands at the front desk. Are you kidding me? As we went to the wine bar to be ripped off for a $20 glass of wine, returning to our room we were interrogated by the elevator security. His comment "We are a nightclub" my relply " I' m sorry I thought I was a GUEST staying in 4 1/2 star HOTEL" ......Sad as the location, staff and the room was great with the exception of closed restaurant and having to pay for an upgrade to an adequete room. Clearly they don't know what they want be but we will not return. Tips: Esplanade shuttle has limited availability and pack your ear plugs if you want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: DutchieGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice, but I found things hit and miss here. I'll list the pros and cons below: Pros: -hotel location - it's close to heaps of restaurants and shops -free soft drinks, water & some snacks each day -free car to drive you to close by places (however you can't book in advance, you just have to wait and see if it's available when you want to go) - good size rooms Cons: -location - yes it's close to stuff, but in the evening walking around I felt quite uneasy as several questionable people seem to be in the area - not helped by the fact that I saw cops arresting a guy out the front of a CVS store near the hotel -the $150 per night hold they put on your card for incidentals - $150 per night ARE YOU KIDDING ME? I'm there by myself, what on earth am I going to spend $150 a night on? Most hotels only block off $50 a night. -the bathroom is completely non functional the sink is in a little alcove outside the actual bathroom. Inside the bathroom is a toilet and the shower. No racks or shelves to hang/place clothes or towels. It's really a strange design! That being said, I asked for a quiet room (which I thought might be pushing it with 2 nightclubs in the hotel and staying over the weekend) but I did get a quiet room (with a view of some gravel and a wall) but I heard no noise from either nightclub during the 3 nights I was there. The staff are very helpful and always talk to you when you enter the hotel (which actually can be a little annoying if you are not in the mood to talk - as I wasn't when I had a horror tour and they asked me how it was and I wanted to say "terrible" but I lied and said it was fine and quickly went to the lifts to save the hassle). I'm not sure if I'd stay here again though. The $150 a night block was a big negative for me because it just seems way to excessive.If this doesn;t bother you so much, then give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sweet rooms”
Reviews.Author: soy888
Reviews.Content: Gaslamp area so you know you're in the heart of SD. Very good service; they provide a few niceties like water, snacks, etc. so you're not forced to pay the crazy prices for the minibar (unless you choose to). Room wasn't a shoebox, and was laid out in a very good manner. All in all, was pretty happy with the hotel, probably book there again the next time I'm in SD.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: We got a room upgrade, picked up from the train station, welcome drink at check in, freebies in the minibar, wristbands for the nightclub. everything was spectacular. Loved the stay. Thanks Mr.Middleton

Reviews.Title: “Nice Gaslamp Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reno30reno
Reviews.Content: The Andaz was a nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay. The location is convenient and everything is within walking distance. The $35/night valet charge is crazy, we parked in a different lot and walked to the hotel after dropping off our luggage. Check your bill on checkout, they charged us for valet even though we did not use the service. That was cleared up, but it should not happen. The room was spacious, we had an extra large king. The complimentary snacks were a nice touch. The lobby/check in was great and very trendy. The internet stations in the lobby were fast and never crowded, we were able to use that to check out entertainment and dining options before heading out each night. The gym was small but well equipped and had a large selection of magazines as well as disposable earphones. Ivy Winebar was unique with wine dispensing machines that allowed us to sample a number of different wines.

Reviews.Title: “In the action, rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: drmalcolm
Reviews.Content: Bang in the middle of the Gaslamp District, full of nightclubs, jazz clubs, restaurant terraces, music, what better location. You give up a sea view and the beauty of the Del Coranado but it is worth it to walk to a different venue every night. It is also very close to all other downtown attractions. Rooftop swimming pool and terrace stunning views. Ask for a view of Petco Park and get a high room. The pool area is noisy at weekends the soundproofing is very good. We always ordered room service breakfast by the pool. the concierge were not kean but the room service waiters had no trouble. they try to be "modern and have no front desk or concierge or bell desk. the idea is that Guest relations do all three with i pads. this doesn"t work at all. they had no knowledge of the town even where a hairdressers was 3 blocks away! they couldn't arrange anything that wasn't standard, but did get good flowers for a family wedding. the hotel gives free limo rides to attractions and restaurants which are close, but we couldnt work out what this was. Sometimes they would take us miles and then refuse 7 blocks. May be something to do with their workload but they couldnt explain that. despit that they try to be very helpful but dont consistently deliver. they should get a good concierge service and give up on an I Store idea. We would go back but now know what to expect, for location, pool and view.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenjram
Reviews.Content: This is a trendy, sophisticated property. The weather in late November was gorgeous, and we even got to use the beautiful pool on the roof. Parking is a bit much; I recommend parking across the street or in a garage around the corner which can range from $5-$13 instead of the $35 valet they offer. We stayed here with kids over Thanksgiving, and I don't know if I would recommend if traveling with family given the huge club scene, especially on the weekends. However, they were very accomodating. The free snacks and drinks in the minibar were a great bonus. Staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “They found the secret formula”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: This new evolved Andaz has invented some synergy of modern amenities, freebies, and a staff of genuine people. And somehow it just swirls and fits together to be very professional and very fun. We were there for business and not only were we VIPs but our vendors who we stated to be at a different hotel were treated as VIP. Escalade rides and all to send them off at night. What kind of return on investment is that for us? And it seems so effortless for the staff to come up with ideas and hand off from one to another. The place is in the heart of the Gaslamp and as such there is sound from across the streets in addition to their own club(s). The whole neighborhood is rockin' and you can't really fault the hotel as such for being "loud". You don't go to Disneyland and complain there are too many kids. True story: We were so relaxed and coddled by Sunday that we forgot to check out! We just had the front desk get our bags from the room to hold for later then we wandered off for lunch. Good thing we had the Escalade scheduled to pick us up so we could formally check out and pay... at 3:30pm! Either come here to have a great time or come here to study how to run a hotel and try to duplicate it in your city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start now slowly going backwards”
Reviews.Author: Ghostrider5408
Reviews.Content: This is still a good Hyatt property with one of the world's best roof top pool/bar/lounge. no doubt. And really attentive staff. Having said that the management is still struggling with the main restaurant, the wine bar is marginal at best, and food not at their best. The hotel is again trying a new operator in the restaurant and hoping that it works, otherwise that will be my last stay and it's a shame. Rooms are starting to fray a bit and need attention

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Five Star service @ Andaz”
Reviews.Author: boraroma
Reviews.Content: Wow, among the best boutique/hip hotel experiences I've ever had. Location is great to start with, property itself is absolutely beautiful, rooms are killer- modern and warm, but staff is really the standout here- really Five Star across the board- manager Karla is great, as is the staff I came across: Doug in the front office, and welcome host Lauren. The rooftop pool which turns into a serious evening nightclub, lived up to the hype. Also rooms were surprisingly quiet, and room service was fast and good. A no brainer top choice for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Jekyll and Hyde”
Reviews.Author: looseseal
Reviews.Content: If I could, I would write two wholly different reviews for this hotel. I stayed here from Wednesday through Saturday to attend a conference. I would give it at least a 4-star rating from Sundays to Wednesdays, but no more than a 1-star rating between Thursdays and Saturdays. Since I can't give it two scores at once, I'm settling for a low average of the two. On Wednesday, this place was heaven. The staff was hospitable; the food was good; there were beautiful design touches all around; the complimentary beverages and snacks were plentiful, including a Keurig brewer with a boxful of coffee and tea packs. I was enjoying the hotel so much that I skipped the conference on the first day to go swimming in the rooftop pool. Then I ordered room service, docked my iPhone docked in their speakers and got some work done in a bathrobe listening to Coltrane. When I came back to the hotel with friends after dinner on Thursday, the whole hotel turned into an extension of their night club. We had to get past a muscly man in a black suit just to get in the lobby, and another one to get in the elevator to go up to our room. Then the dance music started and we thought we were going to lose our minds. The walls and floors were shaking from the bass beats. Music, conversations, and cigarette smoke just came pumping into our room like there were no barriers. It kept going until 2 a.m. when the club shut down. This repeated again on Friday night. By the time we checked out on Saturday, my head was throbbing. If I could be guaranteed that their Ivy night club would not be in operation, I'd consider staying here again. In the absence of this assurance, there's no way I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Andaz is EXTRAordinary”
Reviews.Author: scterminator
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Andaz this past week. This hotel is a grand slam, no doubt about it. Incredibly up tempo, has a very positive vibe and the team members are exceptional in every facet; roof top night club (the Ivy), restaurant, downstairs lounge/bar, wine bar (incredible with samples you can buy for a small amount of money and take an around the world tour through wine tasting). Rooms are spacious, clean, totally relaxing, hotel is located within walking distance of Petco Park and is in the Gaslamp district. Can't wait to return as soon as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hip hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AashC
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel, staff were excellent and upgraded us to a loft room as we were on our honeymoon. Great bar on the top floor which is definitely worth a visit. Excellent location in the heart of the gas lamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: susieand4
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked inside, we felt pampered! Fabulous service, perfect gaslamp location, and beautiful rooftop pool with comfy lounge area and amazing view. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Andaz - Chic and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: cyclingsanchez
Reviews.Content: Contemporary and hip; nicely decorated rooms; by the way this is a Hyatt property. The location is great in the gaslamp district. I did not hear the noise outside which was a nice surprise. The room includes a huge shower (no tub) in a smallish size room but not surprising for the area. Tons of items for sale in the mini fridge, free coffee, tea and water included. Check-in done quickly on an I-Pad (of course); no complaints they were really nice. One small hiccup I asked for a place for dinner, "not too fancy" I was sent to a local seafood restaurant that was $20+ per entree, not my idea of "not fancy". Valet is also extremely expensive even for this area but you are really limited with the parking for this area.

Reviews.Title: “Might be the best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: elenamechlin
Reviews.Content: From the bar to the restaurant to the elevator and especially the room this hotel is top tier all the way. Our room was on the smaller side but gorgeous. Have every intention of staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Andaz Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinder
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic Hotel.Well worth it's 5 star rating. The staff was superb. They would welcome us home when we came ub fir the evening. I would stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stylish hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AllisonM_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with girlfriends for 4 nights, Sunday to Thursday. Unlike all the other reviews, we found the hotel was VERY quiet! The staff kept mentioning the parties & crowd come for the weekend and they are generally quieter off-season. The rooftop bar wasn't open... so no complaints about loud music! We are younger and like a busier scene, so the location (close to restaurants, shopping, bars etc) made up for it. I still think very highly of my stay and the hotel itself! Everything about this place is gorgeous, it has a great vibe and the rooms are clean, new, modern yet comfortable. Little perks like the free mini bar and free wi-fi added that extra touch that we really appreciated during our stay. I used the gym once and the rooftop has great views and comfy loungers - a great spot to relax and hang out. The location is close to everything in the Gaslamp district, tons of restaurants options (some of the best food I've had)! We could easily walk everywhere and if we wanted, the courtesy car was available for pick up/drop off almost everytime we needed it. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: Amagn
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent four nights there this Halloween-weekend. Our room was excellent, the shower unforgetable, all staff very professional and the location was perfect. Nightclub, including rooftop is topclass, trendy and seductive... This was probably one of the busiest weekend they get but without any inconvenience for us, only fun! The crowd was young, stylish and sexy - as well as all the atmosphere. We will definately go there again - hopefully next Halloween.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: hamilton d
Reviews.Content: Andaz is in a great location, walking distance to great restaurant. The rooms are boutique style but modern. Bar on roof top is amazing great views and cool vibe. The hotel also provides a car to pick you up or drop you off, very nice vehicle it was a service we used all weekend. A gentleman named matt the driver took care of us with great advice where to go eat, entertainment etc. Staying at the andaz was perfect hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Services”
Reviews.Author: docvs
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience recently at the Andaz hotel. The staff was very helpful. We especially were impresssed with Matt Kennedy, our driver at the hotel. He was very informative and professional. He provided us with more information than the tour operators. We will be staying here again because of how helpful he was on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: purpleravioli
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Room was quite large. Bathroom had lots of counter space. Comfortable bed. Complimentary snacks from the minibar. Rooftop bar is a great space for a cocktail at sunset. If you're a light sleeper this might not be the place for you. They basically have three nightclubs and you can hear the music in your room. Didn't bother us at all but this hotel has a serious club atmosphere so if that's not your thing you may want to look elsewhere. And as a hotel guest you have access to all the clubs. They also take security very seriously. It's a great alternative to the W. But $35 for parking is just plain CRAZY!!! At least the wi-fi was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Service, Noise Unbearable”
Reviews.Author: bgagnon
Reviews.Content: Andaz is the new Hyatt brand of hip/trendy boutique hotels. Similar to Starwood's W chain this hotel is aimed at the younger crowd with money. This hotel is beautiful in it's look and feel and the staff is overly attentive. Free wifi and water/pop are nice touches that most higher end hotels gauge you for. Rooms are spacious and are visually pleasing. Now the bad part: If you have an exterior facing room and it is the weekend, bring ear plugs. The street noise from the club crowd (Ivy Nightclub is in the hotel) is not only loud it feels like it is in your room. Fights, curses, hoots and hollering go on until well past 3am. Plan accordingly, or be one of those revellers. All in all a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Initial appearances deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Prestovtrun
Reviews.Content: The hotel has some nice features like a rooftop pool and modern architecture but when the nightclub is open it is very noisy in certain rooms, and my room was pulling in smoke when the air conditioner was turned on.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: Gregg60
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant first stay at a boutique hotel near all the action. This hotel is located within a short walk to everything you'd like to do in San Diego. A block from the Gaslamp district, two blocks from Horton Plaza shopping and near Petco Park, the convention center, Balboa Park and a $10.00 taxi fare to the airport. THe room was small but well appointed with complimentary snacks and soft drinks in the room. The staff was attentive and helpful and the rooftop pool and lounge were delightful. We will stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “wasn't wowed, but ok”
Reviews.Author: CAWeekender29
Reviews.Content: I was excited to check out the trendy side of Hyatt and upon check in was impressed. We received complimentary wine, while we checked in on a tablet, we were offered passes to the night clubs, given a tour of the room, each day received complimentary snacks and beverages at the mini bar, fun gaslamp location - great! However after a great first impression the allure faded for me, we could hear music from the clubs on friday and saturday. The sexy see-through shower was not-so-sexy in the am when privacy is needed. The room was spacious, but I wanted more storage space. The staff was pleasant, amenities worked, the club was fun and the restaurant was good, but on the other hand there was noise at night and a crowded lobby from the non-guests waiting club admission. Trendy is fun, but I stay at a hotel for a place to sleep. Overall not more than I expected from a 4 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere if you want a peaceful and quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: Christina C
Reviews.Content: Based on the price of the hotel and making a request for a quiet room, you think it would be possible to get a good night's sleep. Starting thursday night and going into the weekend, the loud street noise and partygoers in the hotel being loud out in the hallway outside rooms is a common occurence. The hotel staff does their job well and is courteous, but this is not a hotel to stay in if you want peace and quiet, or want to go to sleep before 2am and get a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this fantastic hotel Sunday through to Wednesday and can honestly say in my time on business travels have never received such exceptional service from Tyler and the team at reception. Loved the whole vibe so much I will be taking the family next year!

Reviews.Title: “Different -in good ways”
Reviews.Author: gonebutnotdeparted
Reviews.Content: Hotel is as fully appointed as any 4 star but is different from any at which I have stayed in the past. One thing for sure - they don't nickle and dime you. Took my wife for a local getaway and to scope out places for out of town associates. Found complementary wine, sodas, drinks, snacks provided, and yes, even bottles of that valuable H2O that seems to cost 5.00 in other hotel rooms. The place is brand new and decor and materials are very well done. Staff are really, really excellent. I would not pay the $35 for valet unless you are really in a hurry. Plenty of places in the area. The rooftop bar/pool/club is not to be missed. Very comfortable, Huge "fire pit" conversation area, heaters all over, lounges, several cabanas, etc. Oh watch the bar bill though, my Bushmills was $14.00. Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel92679
Reviews.Content: Such a fun place in the heart of San Diego's nightclub and restaurant Gaslamp District. Hotel is trendy, modern and fun - not a typical Hyatt "business" hotel. Check-in is personalized as they great you when you walk in, offer you a chair to sit with a beverage (non-alcoholic) and they check you in using an iPad. Rooms are spacious and larger than typical hotels with very well laid out, smart floor plan. Free drinks and snacks in the room - but be careful, they are next to the "pay" room bar, but the check in host explains all this so you know what is fre and what is not. Sodas, juices, premium bottled water, even mixers are all free! There is even a premium chocolate bar, gourmet potato chips and other snacks for free. Room decor is modern and cool - very fun and perfect for a downtown urban hotel. Everything is new and immaculate - rooms, restaurant, etc. Hotel has a great breakfast/lunch/dinner restaurant with fabulous food and atmosphere. There is also a trendy wine bar that turns nightclub late night, but don't miss the rooftop bar/club - it's one of the best around! Hotel guests get VIP access to all. Come stay here for a night out on the town - I would not recommend for families at all. OK for busienss traveler too. Everything was 5star except one little problem with the hotel elevators around midnight. Since the clubs were open, there were tons of nightclub patrons inthe lobby in line to get upstairs to the rooftop and there was some confusion about hotel guests getting easy and quick access to their rooms - hotel security quickly took care of it, and when I made the reservation they warned me that on Fri & Sat nights, the hotel is home to 2 popular clubs. We had no noise in our room from the clubs which was great. Probably not an issue at all mid-week. Overall, a fantastic hotel and I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD Thursday night into weekend!”
Reviews.Author: AvaandCeliasMom
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly. Very good central location. Checked in Tuesday night, and all was well until Thursday night around 9 p.m. when the music started on both the first and rooftop levels. I had to ask hotel staff for earplugs which made absolutely no impact. Tip if you are not into the party scene: ask for an INTERIOR room. One of my colleagues stayed on the fourth floor, I believe room 401 and their room was very quiet even Thursday evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service. Fantasic & Memorable”
Reviews.Author: FiorinaLeoni
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. From the moment we arrived, Jeff C, our host, took care of us. He understood what we needed and helped make the necessary arrangements. Celebrated a memorable birthday and everything was great. All the staff were friendly, and we enjoyed our stay at this hip and sexy hotel. Thank you to Mark, our chef and Jason, our server. Our dinner experience at The chef's bed, Quarter Kitchen was delicious and catered to us. Thank you so much for the fabulous food, wine and hospitality. We will definately be back one day. Once again, thank you Jeff for being a top notch host and for hooking us up with what we needed. xoxo

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: tom n
Reviews.Content: Wow! Every staff member is "on." Property is beautiful. Room is beautiful. Breakfast and dinner were top-notch. Perfect location. Just off the loud strip but in the middle of it all. Great amenities...free snacks/drinks in room, free internet, nice computers/printer in lobby, big bowl of fresh apples in lobby. Fantastic service looked effortless. Hip but unpretentious. Quiet, spacious room, upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Service”
Reviews.Author: wam3
Reviews.Content: The valets are incredible--what a great start! Staff is warm, friendly and willing to go to great lengths to make your stay wonderful. One of the front desk agents gave me directions to Starbucks (late night). When I came back empty handed (they had closed), she insisted on making me coffee and bringing it to my room. The rooftop staff caught on to my love of coffee, and had it ready to go for my entire stay. The welcome beverage is a nice touch. My room was great, loved the decor and the music playing when I walked in. The hotel is in the middle of the Gaslamp, so I barely needed the car. Be aware it can get a little crazy on weekend nights, which I loved. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staycation”
Reviews.Author: kell2011
Reviews.Content: As locals, we're likely to be more skeptical of a place than a tourist but we found Andaz a great surprise. The staff was very friendly (what? a free glass of wine at check in? Free water and snacks in our room?!?) and even offered to text us when our room was ready. The hotel was hip enough to remind us of a New York hotel we recently visited. The hotel must rock the rooftop pool on the weekends since we were there on a Sun. night and the DJ had the uber chic 20 somethings entertained. Only thing preventing a 5 star is the fact that our room faced the street and I could see it being louder on a Sat. night.

Reviews.Title: “Really no complaints. Had a great relaxing time.”
Reviews.Author: Brittally
Reviews.Content: We flew in the night of the black-out so the welcome beverage of course, did not happen. Only fluke was they had a hard time finding our reservation which also could have been related to the black out( we had a confirmation, they has sent US a reminder, we had pre-payed for the room and completed early check in on line and they still couln't find us). Elevators were out so the poor girl had to drag our suitcases up 5 flights of stairs. I know they are all are fighting over tips but really, there was 4 guys at least; standing in the lobby. The room was great. A lot of mirrors help to make it feel bigger than it really is. It was hot when we got there but, no air with the power being out. Came back on by 3:00 A.M. so no biggie. Bathroom was pretty cool/modern with the big shower between the room and the bath. Note this is not a room to share with your buddies!! Mixers,water bottles etc. are free though one day they did not replace what we had used. Alchohol bottles in the room are at a premium price though after having a few drinks at the rooftop bar we may as well have opened them instead. Drinks $13 to $15 a piece.The decor is wonderful and was very relaxing up there. Has a personal pizza appitizer which was quite good. The wine bar looked pretty awesome but after seeing the prices of the rooftop bar drinks we found other happy hours in the area!! The second night we were out and about going to dinner and a comedy. Upon returning we had to laugh as the security was a little intense. Guys on head sets "guests in the lobby. guests in the lobby" and escorted us up to our floor. We did feel safe however. There always seemed to be at least 3-4 staff members in the lobby at all times. The noise was not all that bad. We were on the 5th floor facing the front of the hotel. A few drunk laughs and sirens but not enough to keep us awake. Did not do the club scene as we are a litle past ort prime for that venue. I can also say having never stayed downtown before that you could probably stay for a month and never eat at the same place twice. Hundreds of restuarants with-in a few blocks. The valets are really friendly and can suggests great places. Never felt underdressed even after spending the day at the beach. You do probably want to dress for dinner/night life. Check out was a breeze and no extra charges etc. But yes, the valet parking was $35 per night which did not include many tips as we were in and out with our car quite a bit. Over all it was a great place to stay and yes we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Charles N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were coming from New York on a direct evening flight and when we arrived we were offered drinks to unwind (juices, wine, water, etc.) before going to the room. Check-in was quick; they use Vaio or iPads to check-in/out. My wife had questions of places to go in the area for a manicure and the hostess was very helpful. I also asked what I would receive as a Diamond member of Hyatt and she did a very thorough run down (which I appreciated because I travel frequently and can't always remember which hotel gives what). We had a junior suite (the worst part about this place was that it only has 3 master suites, so not getting one of those even as a Diamond member AND using a suite upgrade award netted me just the Jr. Suite) and I had hoped to get a great room. If I had known this prior to going then I would have saved my suite award and just paid for the room. As I mentioned above the worst part was my high expectations of the room I was going to get, but outside of that this was a great place to stay. The nightclub they have there is a top club to go to (the line was around the corner, but as hotel guests we got wrist bands at the front desk to access all 3: Pool Rooftop, Wine bar & Basement) and the staff was extremely helpful, personable and friendly. You can notice they truly care about making your stay as great a stay as possible. *The best nights to party are Thursday & Saturday in SD BTW, so when we arrived on Friday it was a bit slower but still a great time* We also ordered room service while we were there (24hrs) and those guys are also awesome. Again, over the phone they were helpful with describing the dishes and even though one of the orders was messed up, they IMMEDIATELY fixed it -felt like no wait time. We also ordered late at night and the overnight staff was as excellent as the eat-in room service staff during the day, again I say EXCELLENT. *As a side note, in the jr. suite room there were complimentary juices (orange, ice tea, and cranberry), water, sodas, granola bar, chocolate bar and chips. This is not done everywhere and as a business traveler having that stuff come with the room makes all the difference.* The location of the hotel is also central to downtown activities. We had no problem walking everywhere we needed to go as we stayed mostly downtown. My recommendation to you, if you are considering this place, is to stay no other location than the Andaz San Diego. I plan on coming back to San Diego and I will certainly be staying at this location to have a GREAT TIME!.

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing Hospitality"”
Reviews.Author: travelbug215
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time staying here. The complimentary glass of wine upon check-in, Vladimir's excellent service in changing our room to a more comfortable setting for my mom and me, complimentary snack basket, and everyone being so courteous and friendly made our stay one of the best that I've ever experienced. The rooms are nicely decorated with all the modern technology. The only drawback was the shower. It was a bit challenging to get the nozzle to spray directly on me, being petite and there needs to be some type of hook to hang your clothing and robe. The wine bar is a must visit. It's so cool with the different machine generated pourings! Overall, a most definite visit!

Reviews.Title: “Went far beyond the call of duty...”
Reviews.Author: BeantownPeter
Reviews.Content: Remember the black-out in early Sept (2011) that took out all of San Diego and then some? Yah, well I stayed at this hotel during this freak out. I had to take a moment to recognize each staff member as they handled the whole situation with ease, professionalism, and class. No, I don't work there, promise. Anyway, I was there for a conference that was taking place that week and the manager on duty made sure everyone was well taken care of but, prob more importantly, safe as well. The front desks guys offer water when you go for a run, the breakfast room service tastes AMAZING! And, the rooms themselves are really, really nice - love the double headed shower. The only issue, if anything, is that it's located in the heart of the party/night life district so be prepared to hear a lot of "woo hoo's" and laughing through your windows into the night. But hey, the place is cool, sheek, and not a bad place to stay if that's how you like to party anyway. Cheers to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Andaz San Diego...glass of cabernet when we checked in, complimentary transportation, snacks, drinks, etc. Unbelievable rooftop bar and pool, great rooms and the employees, especially Tom at the front desk, were incredibly courteous, knowledgeable and friendly. Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDon1
Reviews.Content: Just had a sales meeting at the Andaz, Great service and location. The employees are eager to please and take care of all your needs. Rooms were very nice and the location in the gaslamp district is super. Parking is only Valet and 35 bucks a day so be aware. About the same everywhere downtown...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, fun place”
Reviews.Author: EarthWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Very good location, fun place with great views from the rooftop which also serves as a great pool area and popular nightclub. Great concierge staff. Take advantage of the free executive car for transportation to surrounding nightspots.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, great location, but noisy..”
Reviews.Author: kerry0072
Reviews.Content: Having re-read the reviews of this hotel, I concur with the reviewer about the noise which a bit of an issue, but with earplugs, you can get over it. The hotel is super stylish and the staff are very helpful and efficient. The room is modern, I particularly liked the glass bath and shower and complimentary drinks and snacks. As the room has really cool bars and clubs, you do get alot of guests and I was woken up by someone running down the corridor shouting, but I put ear plugs in and quickly went back to sleep. We asked for a late check out and paid $40 to check out at 5pm as we were not leaving until 8.30 pm flight. This was good, but wished we did not have to pay for it given the hotel was not full. I would recommend this hotel and enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great amenities, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyF123
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here because it sounded nice and was slightly cheaper than the other options I was looking at in the Gaslamp Quarter (~$175 a night + tax, right before a holiday weekend). And when I arrived, I thought I had majorly lucked out. They let me check in really early (around 11 am) and the room was really sleek and modern looking (which I like). I ended up splashing water on myself and the floor, because I couldn't figure out how to use the modern sink and shower at first, but that's not a big deal. That evening I checked out the rooftop pool and bar and the Quarter Kitchen restaurant downstairs. The rooftop area is awesome, both in terms of the pool and the bar, and the food in the restaurant was really good, probably the best I had in San Diego. However, when I returned to my room for the night, I discovered why my room was so cheap. There is a club in the basement of the hotel, and my room over looked an air shaft/patio area adjacent to the club. From my room I could hear the music from the club fairly loudly, and occasionally also people talking. It wasn't too bad when I was watching tv, but it made it difficult to sleep -- eventually I had to call down to the desk for ear plugs. Luckily I am used to street noise and sleeping with ear plugs, so I was able to get to sleep easily after that, and luckily clubs close early in San Diego, around 2 am, so I only had to deal with it for 2-3 hours. So it didn't completely ruin my stay. However if you are a light sleeper, or plan to go to bed early, the Andaz probably isn't for you. If you can deal with the noise, everything else about the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. Customer service is top notch!”
Reviews.Author: RollTideandGoTitans
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here over the Labor Day weekend and were blown away. The customer service alone makes it a must stay. As soon as you pop in the lobby for any reason you are greeted and asked if there is anything they can do for you, whether it is getting you something to drink or helping you get transportation. (There is an Escalade that will take you within 2 miles of the hotel, and the driver was excellent. Very nice.) The rooms are unique, with the exposed showers. If you're staying with a friend or are in a platonic relationship, you probably will have to work around that, but if you're in a romantic relationship it isn't a big deal. I've assume you have seen your partner naked. Don't worry, though, the toilet area is private. No lock but you can't see through the door. While you may look sexy showering when your mate can see you, no one looks cool on the throne, so fortunately you can do that in private. The bed was very comfortable. I was out like a light despite reviews I had heard about noise. About that, the place has a nightclub in it but it didn't bother us. It was noisy in the streets but again, you're in Party Central with all the bars and clubs so if you are upset about that, then you didn't do research. It would be like attending a Steelers/Chargers game and complaining about the experience because you didn't know they would be playing football. My girlfriend and I were in bed watching True Blood on Sunday (we're not as young as we used to be) and the nightlife sounds didn't distract us. The complimentary items were a plus, too. Obviously you have to pay for the hooch, but the soft drinks and water were free. I liked that, usually you have to drop a little for a Coke or Sprite in other hotels if you take it from the fridge . Lots to do in the area. Ask the staff, they'll hook you up. I have read complaints about the security staff being hardheaded when it came to actual guests trying to get to their rooms when the club opened, but I didn't encounter it. I just showed them my room card and they were nice, and would have an elevator waiting. I have a feeling some of the complainers were probably drunk, tired, didn't have the room key handy, and when security just wanted to confirm for safety reasons, the guests copped an attitude. Probably L.A. types. I live there, so I know how they can be. Heck, they even give you a drink (not alcohol, obviously) for the road when you check out. They know you're leaving, they can pull a "Well, we're done with them, our service ends now", but nope. A little road soda, juice, or water to send you on the way. So stay here. You will have fun. But remember, this is in a popular location of nightlife. There will be noise. There will be drunk people. But you will have fun. BTW, there is an Afghan restaurant diagonally across the street called Chopahn. Check it out. It is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Gaslamps”
Reviews.Author: MrT69
Reviews.Content: Lauren and Ashley were incredibly friendly and professional hosts upon my arrival. They treated me like royalty and shared many laughs with me. They provided me every service requested and the hotel was immaculately clean and quite artistic in presentation. I only ate breakfast there and it was, what can I say, breakfast. Hard to make it bad. Service was superb in both server presentation and timeliness of delivery. Valet service was amazingly quick and also extremely frinendly and helpful. I don't think they failed to ask me if I need directions. Rooftop bar was, once again, dripping with hospitality. We had a great time in our one visit there. The only drawback to the hotel is the noise level, which they warn you about on their web site. They have 3 clubs in the hotel and from Thursday through Sunday there is significant traffic out front and noise from the DJ's. I wore earplugs and slept through it, but it could be deemed a drawback for others. Club access is extremely well monitored and controlled by hotel staff, but there is an increase in noise. Room was incredible in layout and cleanliness. Maid service was amazing. Lovely hotel and, once again, ask for the 2 girls mentioned initially as they will treat you like Royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Gaslamp Quarter ! THE PLACE TO BE!”
Reviews.Author: Switzerland007
Reviews.Content: The Andaz San Diego is the best of all Andaz so far! And even for a reasonable price! I had a room rate of USD 139.-- while a 48 hour sale on hyatt.com. This was a very good deal for a Hotel in the historic Gaslamp Quarter. Unfortunately I stayed there Monday to Wednesday. So at their famous roof-top was not a lot going on.. Mini bar is included and: as a Diamond Guest I got an Upgrade into the Loft-Suite which was faboulous!!!! YESSSS! .... A little problem: nobody cares about all the students who are coming to the rooftop because they know, that they can come up to the pool deck and the hotel doesn't care. It's ok as long as there are enough beach chairs available..... Very nice Happy hour drinks for USD 5.--!!!

Reviews.Title: “brag-worthy”
Reviews.Author: babibirdee
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend and I pulled up to the Andaz Hotel dressed in cargo shorts and hiking boots (we'd gone hiking & climbing) and even though, we were treated like royalty the instant we pulled up. The hotel is sexy and it smells so damn good. You have no idea how amazing it was to walk in to the Andaz after a long, tiresome day. The atmosphere was soothing and as we checked in we were offered a complimentary beverage (wine, iced tea, water.) Instantly, we knew we were not leaving this property until the moment we had to check-out. We stayed in a Large King Suite, this room is definitely created for a couple. The room was clean, cute, and cozy. There was music playing in the room to set the *mood*. The exposed shower encouraged foreplay. The bed was comfy. Although we did not take full advantage of the amenities the hotel had to offer, we did check out the restaurant on-site as well as the rooftop pool. Both were fancy and brag-worthy. If I had it my way, we would have stayed at the Andaz the entire time we were visiting San Diego, however we were forced to stay at a different place the majority of the week (work!) I will definitely return to the Andaz the next time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very inflexible”
Reviews.Author: Matthew R
Reviews.Content: I booked a very restrictive reservation so it is completly my fault that I ended up in this predicament when I tried to push my stay back by one month. I would have at least expected the Andaz to cut me some sort of a deal. Both times I called they were not helpful at all and would not offer even the slightest concession. They already have my $500 and had a chance to make some more. They could have thrown in a complementary meal, or anything, and I would have jumped at it and left greatful. Thanks for nothing, Andaz.

Reviews.Title: “Worst part of my wedding was staying here”
Reviews.Author: erikasaw13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before and the night of my wedding in July. Everything about the day was absolutely perfect...with one exception, staying at the Andaz. We paid for early check in and were not able to check in until AFTER their normal check in time, which is a very late 4pm. The staff was nice and kind, but they did not follow through with their promises. I expected that after bringing guests to stay in more than 10 rooms at their establishment AND it being the most important day of my life, I would get service that was above and beyond exceptional. Well, I can honestly say I have received better, more timely and accurate service at Motel 6. Upon returning to our 1st floor suite (after requesting a higher floor upon making the reservation) we found the room had not been cleaned. There was still breakfast stuffs from that morning, trash and dirty towels and the bed was still as it was when I had left early that day. This is most upsetting because I had spoken with the maid personally and asked that she please return at a specific time, once we had left, to get the room prepared for the bride and grooms' return. My Maid of honor had also spoken with the front desk to see that the room be cleaned and perhaps given an extra special touch, being it our wedding night and all.... Well, in my white gown, I ended up cleaning the room myself. Not the most romantic thing ever. It is a good thing we got superb, out of this world service on our honey moon in a 3rd world country...because the Andaz sure as hell let us down, big time.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: doctorjdds
Reviews.Content: Staffed greeted us by name every afternoon upon return from our conference....nice touch! Bathroom was super ....biggest shower ever! complementary water/soft drinks, etc...where do you find that these days??!! nice roof top bar/terrace/pool!! only slight negative was one electrical outlet didn't work. would DEFINITLEY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, great location (not ideal for familiies)”
Reviews.Author: Burywood
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this hotel, located right in the heart of San Diego's gaslamp district. We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to from here and the taxi journey to the Zoo and Seaworld was short. The hotel was not ideal for families, but if my wife and I were on a weekend break by ourselves it would be a fantastic place to stay. The roof top pool was stunning (but cold!) and the roof top bar had great views (you could almost watch a baseball game from there!). We had bar food on the roof one evening which was actually really very good. Beds are very soft.

Reviews.Title: “No way and don't take your family there”
Reviews.Author: bex r
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was horrible. We had two kids with us and no one told us that the entire hotel shakes from the club on Friday and Saturday nights not to mention the house music blaring all night. The other patrons were belligerently drunk running the halls. On more than one occasion you would walk by a room and find blankets strewn in the hall with vomit from either over served or over intoxicated guests. The rooms are cold and non-private not to mention small. The shower leaked water all over the floor, when we reported it the response was, â€œwe are having problems with our showersâ€�. You can hear everything in the hall at all hours of the night and the cleaning of the hotel areas happens at 5am so if itâ€™s not bad enough you were up all night from the club the vacuums start running right after. Valet parking is inconvenient and expensive. The $125.00 a night incidental charge is inconvenient to the pocketbook for any traveler on a budget. We booked this hotel for a wedding party and had to move half the attendees, absolutely not a family friendly hotel! Patrons should be warned of the incidental charges and the nature of this environment. I attempted to take my kids to the pool which is also littered with Alcohol and rude patrons upset that there were two children there. I will never stay at this hotel again and will not recommend it to any of my professional or personal contacts.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: waynelv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It is right in the gaslamp quarter with easy access to everything. There is a couple of negatives. The hotel will hold $150 per day of your stay for incidentals and there is a $35 per day valet charge. The staff is amazing.
