Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Andaz over the Memorial Day weekend with my wife and some friends from our high school days. The rooftop club was great with incredible views of the San Diego skyline. In the morning it was converted to a small breakfast cafe that was awesome. We spent 2 1/2 hrs there in the a.m. The hotel staff was very attentive to us as guests, and did an outstanding job from the front desk, to the waiters, to the security staff at the club. The GM, Rusty Middleton, went out of his way to take care of us personally. Many thanks. We will be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: whoopwhoop27
Reviews.Content: We just spent a great weekend at the Andaz Hotel. We had a great time. The room was clean and the shower was great. We would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return soon. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Tale of Ivy...”
Reviews.Author: aeroAdvocate
Reviews.Content: Hyatt recently added a new piece to itâ€™s freshly designed â€˜Andazâ€™ Collection â€“ The Andaz San Diego. After having a little tour earlier last month I decided it was time for a stay to evaluate the hotel upon eventual pros & cons as I had to stay a day in SD anyway. I booked 2 Rooms on a Thursday departing friday. To say it upfront: I did not find too many pro-arguments. First, the web check-in did not work. Upon personal check-in I was explained that the rooms are not ready yet (12:15pm). I advised the staff that I reserved with an arrival time of 11:30a after arriving from a long haul ex Asia. Suddenly they found 2 rooms, though not on the same floor but so be it. Then they proudly mentioned I have been upgraded to a "Loft" to which I responded that this is not really an upgrade per se, I used a Diamond Suite Certificate and if they could elaborate what "Loft" means. It ended up being a regular room with a diverter in the middle and a desk/couch behind it. The bathroom was smaller than in the other (Standard) room. The second reservation did not receive a Diamond Upgrade. Also my "Loft" did not have a bathtub which I specifically requested. They offered a downgrade to a room with a bathtub - great option! The whole CI process took 40 minutes. An embarrassing situation to say the least and just proof of the low key performance many of the Andaz properties are providing on a daily basis. The parking is 30$ - not too bad for SD but not cheap either. Facilities: The roof is supposed to be the crown jewel of the hotel. It consists of a restaurant/bistro area, sitting area, bar and the pool with the well equipped but not very airy gym on the same floor. The pool is roughly 1.20m deep. To give you the picture, this reaches barely the top of my shorts. Swimming is possible on 2/3 length of the pool. Beware of your knees! My impression was, that the pool is more for a quick "cool down walkthrough" and "cocktail hangout" than serving its purpose as an actual swimming pool. There are ~ 7 sun beds, 3 Cabanas without shields and 3 half open sun chairs plus a sofa area with a TV. The Audio system surrounding the pool changed its volume level every 3 minutes - maybe they were probing "The Apprentice" for San Diego's DJ scene. The breakfast was served on said bistro area the next morning. Service was ok - not more not less. I am Hyatt Diamond so the breakfast was included for my room automatically, the second room had the breakfast included per the AAA Rate I booked. The bar staff created proper drinks. The food which has been ordered poolside was of good quality and freshly prepared. It missed the special touch regarding presentation though which somewhat would be expected considering the pricing model. We did not use the restaurant downstairs as we ate out but ordered a dessert later from room service. A chocolate tart that was supposed to come with Hazelnut Ice Cream. The night staff had their creative Thursday so they decided to substitute the Hazelnut Ice cream with a spoon of almond/nut mix. Nice try but that wonâ€™t fly. After an interesting discussion with the room service operator the ice cream was delivered ~ 25 minutes later. Short before the cake dried out. "The IVY Nightclub" on the roof is one of the hip spots in San Diego - At least this particular Thursday night I could not tell you why. Maybe it gets a bit better once summer settles in and they donâ€™t need the heaters anymore. Guests receive a fancy IVY wristband so no ID checks etc are required anymore. You will get these starting at 8:30pm at the Front Desk. The beds are the biggest plus of the Hotel. Very cozy and comfortable. The bathrooms are compact but nicely assembled paired with hardwood flooring. Assorted bathroom amenities were available as well as plush bathrobes and good towels. All rooms are individually designed and in the hallways are original art pieces and individual carpets. The furniture already shows some usage but is still acceptable. Within the hotel there are certain sources of noise, the nightclub being one of them. Especially in the interior rooms with the windows towards the inside courtyard are in the target line of this. The carpets in the hallways are somewhat noise redeeming so that the guests returning from the various night venues are not alerting everyone on the same floor. The hardware is good - however the hotel seriously lacks in one important field and that is unfortunately in professionalism and customer satisfaction. There seemed to be no senior management on site. At least none that comes from a full service Hyatt. It was all pretty junior staff and the Andaz specific IT is not making their job easier. 3 hours after I left the hotel I received an email alert from my credit card the hotel just authorized more then 200$ - again. In the meanwhile this charge hit my account permanently even though the manager assured the reversal of the charge. The bill looks like a ping pong game as they already credited and debited my CC "by accident" more than 5 times. Greetings to the accounting! Bottom Line: It doesnâ€™t matter what demographic group you belong to - there are standards that a full service property in the Hyatt chain (even if under a different name) should fulfill. Servicewise, this particular place needs serious support from Hyatt Senior Management in nearly all fields of daily operation. From a professional point of view, the stay was a disaster. My friends enjoyed it though which I am very glad about and if you look at it the casual way then there is some leeway and the property getâ€™s away with some things. As a guest who knows other Andaz properties as well I can just say there is more than just space for improvement. When every second phrase has to be an apology then something is fundamentally wrong. The name Ivy can not compensate everything !

Reviews.Title: “Great, Laid-Back, Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessicaBear
Reviews.Content: I just finished an incredibly enjoyable and relaxing 4-night stay at the Andaz San Diego. Upon first arriving, the staff impressed me with their friendliness and professionalism. I scored a cheap room through Hotwire, so I was concerned that I'd be treated like a peon instead of like royalty, but that didn't happen at all. The room was beautiful and luxurious, if a little small. There was a great mini-bar, complete with some complimentary offerings such as soda, juice, chips, chocolate, and a granola bar. The bed was super comfy, except the pillows could have been a little firmer. The shower was relaxing. The free wireless was fast and reliable. There was also an ipod dock in the room. The coffee maker yielded just okay coffee, but it did the trick. The hotel also had a great little exercise room, with a few treadmills, elliptical machines and bikes, plus a couple of weight machines. Each machine had its own television and there were complimentary headphones provided. The machines all seemed very new and in great condition. My boyfriend and I treated ourselves to room service the first night and were floored by how delicious it was. The cheeseburger and mac 'n' cheese, especially, were exceptional. The $30/night for valet service seems pricey, but luckily, I didn't bring my car. Andaz's location makes for a very walkable vacation. I easily got to the zoo, Balboa Park, the Casbah, movie theatres, and tons of restaurants and shops on foot. The hotel was exceptionally quiet. I barely even heard other people staying there. Overall, I would enthusiastically recommend this hotel to friends and would gladly stay there again, and would also try other Andaz locations.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan to sleep!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimdav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice if you are in your twenties and plan on partying at the club on the roof then in your room till 5am! Not nice is you try to go to sleep any time before 5am. Vallet are rude and will not move traffic along. We had a room with a suite door and the young girls sahring that common door salmed it all night. Nice rooms but could use some serious sound proofing!

Reviews.Title: “Classy innovative concept”
Reviews.Author: qkslvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Thursday prior to a cruise using priceline.com. Andaz is a Hyatt property, and is a unique experience. They don't use a traditional front desk, the concierge/hosts check you in by laptop/tablet PC. They offer complimentary wine on check-in, and have a lot of complimentary items in the mini bar, as well as free wifi and wifi laptops available for guest use in the lobby. The rooms were very nice, ours had a nice glassed in large tub/ shower combo with nice toiletries, as well as a panel to provide privacy between the shower and sleeping area. Our other family members mentioned that their room had no privacy from the shower to the room. There was a nice 42" flat panel tv and ipod dock, as well as a desk and side chair. The curtains were very thin, but our room had a blackout shade behind the curtain to keep the morning light out. The hosts were very friendly, asked us to come down for free wine, and helped us with local restaurant choices. Location is in the GasLamp District, so we were within walking distance to many great restaurants. We didn't notice any of the noise others have mentioned, we had a corner room on the fifth floor. We didn't use the hotel bar or restaurant, but the by the glass wine bar looked very enticing. The rooftop pool area waas very secluded, and there were great sitting areas on the rooftop. It was a steal at my priceline bid of $71, and it is a great value at 4 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atarnove
Reviews.Content: This is a nice location, rooms are a bit tight but nicely appointed. Very hip and trendy... We booked on Priceline....we were disappointed that we were told upon arrival that Priceline only guarentees 1 queen bed for 2 travelers ( I beleive we were given a double bed.....this was not going to work for my travel comapanion and I).~ After a bit of a wait we were offered 1 king bd. Nice room...clean and newly decorated. Note to check on Pricelines guarentee.... All was fun and great...but agree with the advise that you should not stay on a Thurs - Sat if you need to sleep. The Techno Beat......gets louder and louder as the night goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service, uncomfortable rooms, disappointing general manager!”
Reviews.Author: jcro1495
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire. I accidentally booked the wrong nights and the assistant manager with hotwire on the phone agreed to a reduced rate for 2 nights. The Andaz still received my hotwire payment and we agreed I would pay the difference since it was my mistake. I reiterated with the assistant manager I was traveling on business and needed to stay within a specific rate. Thought everything was OK since 2 colleagues recieved hotwire rates even much lower. Instead I was hassled and basically told I was a liar about the agreed upon rate by the general manager. On my second day I was contacted to leave the hotel 3 times. I explained I booked for 2 nights and confirmed again my rate. Upon leaving the general manager looked at the note about my rate, noticed the exact agreed upon amount I mentioned yet INSISTED there was a mistake. I told him I was responsible for the amount above my already paid hotwire and he said the assistant manager who was not there should not have provided my lower rate. He then proceeded to bill me over $100 ABOVE the rate HE SAW IN THE COMPUTER SYSTEM. When I approached him about this twice he said the assistant manager was not there and that until he figured out why I received such a low rate he would be forced to charge my credit card. I mentioned again my two colleagues actually stayed through hotwire for a rate even lower and that I was willing to pay more just not the $100 more he was trying to charge me. I also mentioned hotwire was on the phone to confirm and he even has a note in system with the agreed upon rate. He said it is "complicated" because the manager should not have had the authority to do this. Essentially after the second time I stated it is an internal problem with the hotel and that he was essentially saying he did not believe the other managers note. His response was that he would not bill my credit card until later that day and confirm with the manager. So when I left I was charged over $100 above what was agreed and he wasted over 30 minutes of my time trying to explain this. I had an afternoon business meeting and left without continuing to argue since it was clear he was going to charge my card anyway. Terrible customer service. In addition the hotel was not that great. The bathroom is weird and the shower points straight at your face so I basically had to duck to wash my hair. The entire hotel is very snooty. On the first night at the supposed "hot spot" rooftop bar the bartender told us the next night would be "off" and the greatest place in San Diego and there would be a line, but since we were in the hotel we would be good with wristbands. Well good thing we had wristbands for the lame 25 person scene the next night. When we asked him he was like, well come back on the weekend sorry! The entire hotel is run by rude want to be black suit wearing wannabe New York nightclub bouncers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for singles, not families”
Reviews.Author: theallens04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my husband and my 11 month old son. The hotel is in a great location, easy walk to many destinations. Nightly parking was $30, a little pricey. The hotel is very trendy, rooms are super clean, bed was very comfortable. The negative was that we were given a room off of the atrium where the music/nightclub started at 9 pm and went until 1:30am. It was very loud...I couldn't get my son to sleep with the noise. I called the front desk and they said they were sold out and could not move us. Also, the room we were given had a see thru bathroom. the wall to the bathroom was glass, so when either of us went to the bathroom or shower...it was seen by the other. My son is young so he didn't get it...but toddler or older kids...I wouldnt have been happy about it. If you are single and want to party this is the place for you, but for a family..I'd say check out other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of freebies”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with colleagues for a conference and my boss booked three rooms for five people on hotwire for something like $90/room/night. Considering the going rate was about three times that amount, we got a very good deal. We were pleasantly surprised when the rooms did not have glass walls around the bathroom. All three of our rooms were king beds for five colleagues, so sharing beds was enough for us. I agree with many of the other reviews about the service, noise, rooms, etc. One thing that is very impressive is the amount of things that are "complimentary." There are two computers in the lobby for you to check email and there is free wireless throughout the property. They have a happy hour with wine from 5pm to 6pm. There is coffee and pastries in the morning. About half of the things in the minibar in the room are complimentary including water, juice, candy, and snacks. The minibar even has an erotic kit thing. I can only imagine what is in it. The toiletries in the bathroom were excellent and there were lots of little packets of creams and lotions that smelled really nice. Of course the only drawback was the noise from the club downstairs. The rooftop party space was closed because of the rain. Since we hotwired the rooms we were given low, third floor inside rooms all around the small atrium that opens to the club. I had ear plugs in and the music was still loud. I didn't fall asleep until the music stopped around 2:00am I think. I certainly wouldn't pay the going rate to stay at this place again and if I did I would make sure that it was indeed a quiet room. If you have a car, be prepared to pay $30/day for valet. There is no self-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxe Boutique Hotel with a small price tag!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasGurl
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel when booking on Hotwire. At first I was nervous about this choice, primarily because of the reveiws about the noise. But, of course, there are no refunds so I was on my way! OK so I stayed on sat and sunday night. I asked for a "quiet" room and I woke up a few times on Sat night due to noise. It was not too bad but not quite quiet and it did not ruin my whole night's sleep. However, Sunday night I slept great! If you plan on staying in Thurs-Sat night and not partaking in the party atmosphere in san diego, truthfully I would stay away from a lot of the hotels in Gaslamp. It is full of city noises and booming bass...not for the light sleeper. Ask for a quieter room, bring earplugs, use the ipod dock for soft background noise, or a sleeping pill to combat the noise if needed - but it was not awful - the bed was super comfy so it made up for it! Another word of warning you may have heard - the room's bathroom (except toilet) is open for full view from the bed, chairs,etc. The wall is made out of glass. It was fine for me since I was there by myself. And it would be cool with a partner. But if you are planning to travel with just a friend, it would be uncomfortable - you will see your friend's everything - haha! On the other hand - everything else is outstanding. complimentry treats from the mini-bar. Luxe Korres bath products. Glam rooftop pool, excellent drinks. Great, quick, understanding service...everything else is fantastic! Sunday - Wed would not hesitate to stay here one bit. Thurs-Sat night - some may want to think twice due to noise - but it did not ruin my stay at all...in fact it was quite great!

Reviews.Title: “No Rest for The Wicked or anyone else for that matter!!”
Reviews.Author: VP-travel-club
Reviews.Content: We had spent a week at the Del and moved to the Ivy for the last night before flying out to Mexico. We thought what a beautiful, modern hotel. Loved the bathrooms, etc. Until the music started. It was like your bed was on the dance floor, even with ear plugs there was no hope of sleep. The bass pounding interfered with your heart beat. I wish I had check Tripadvisor first!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: jay379
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a Saturday-Monday a few weeks ago and I really had a great time at this hotel. There is some high and low points to this hotel and I can see it will not be for everyone, but I wanted to share my experience. STAFF: My girlfriend and I pulled up to the valet and were instantly greeted by a friendly attendant. Check in was a breeze: The staff noticed I was a Gold Hyatt Member and offered me a complimentary 2p check out (I didn't end up using it, but was quite happy with the offer). The staff escorted us up to our room and gave us all the instructions on using their complimentary Cadillac Escalade service and setting up a time for us to pick up our VIP passes for the club (included with the room). We ended up taking up the offer on the Cadillac service to and from a restaurant in down town and had great drivers that saved us the hassle of walking or cabbing, well worth giving them a tip! Location: The hotel is right in the heart of Gas Lamp. Tons of great restaurants, pubs and nightlife to get yourself into. We did end up at the roof top club of the hotel. It was a great time, but the drink prices were RIDICULOUS. A mixed cocktail (Crown & Coke) is around 12-15 bucks so most of our drinking happened before the club. However, if you are here to party on a Friday/Saturday night, it is well worth checking it out. Room: I was not a big fan of the room. We were in an Andaz Queen and it was real cramped (see pictures). The bathroom was also real compact and for some reason there was an open hole towel holder on the glass of the shower. This caused the whole bathroom to get full of water whenever we used the shower. I'm not sure about the other rooms, but I would probably consider trying to upgrade to a King if I stayed here again. Surprisingly, I did not here any noise like other reviewers from the night club. I think it all depends on where you are located in the hotel and we were on the 3rd floor. The room did come with some complimentary soft drinks and bath robes in the closet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends or another couple, but would not recommend it for my parents or a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Fun, Function is another story”
Reviews.Author: sosweho
Reviews.Content: The newly-rebranded Andaz San Diego is in the heart of San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter nightlife district, and is a destination for the cool and the hip. While the Hyatt-owned nameplate cometes with the established W brand, it does not feel like a copycat. If you're on business or traveling with family, there may be better options in downtown, but if you are single or a couple, it is definitely worth a visit. The rooftop pool turns into a rocking bar at night, making the hotel lobby feel more nightclub than hotel, and there can be noise from other bars and clubs in the neighborhood. A warning to anyone traveling with non-romantic interests: the Andaz has showers are all-class boxes that open into the bedroom, so there is no privacy. On the positive side, soft drinks, snacks and wifi are complimentary, and they do put the hotel guests first.

Reviews.Title: “We lucked out at this beautiful hotel !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HBLovers
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on a room at this hotel through hotwire. After the booking when we received the name of the hotel, which was advertised on hotwire as 4.5 stars, we went to tripadvisor to read the reviews. We were pretty upset and disappointed to see all the negative reviews about the noise and the clubby atmosphere. But we went anyway, having paid our reservation in full, and hoped for the best. Well, we were pleasantly surprised and had an absolutely marvelous stay ! The hotel is beautiful and trendy and the staff is outstanding. Very impressive. At check in, knowing about the noise problem, we asked if they could put us in the quietest location possible. They graciously upgraded us to an executive king on the third floor, facing the street. We never heard any noise, all night long!!! Slept like babies. The room was beautifully furnished, the bed and linens were luxurious, and the mini bar was stocked with all kinds of wonderful things, some of which were complimentary. The giant tub was a treat too. If we knew we could get this room again, we would go back in a heartbeat. Not sure if we were just lucky, or if the hotel is making more of an effort to acomodate guests who like to sleep !!! All in all, we feel like we really lucked out with a great price for a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nightclub...not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyechip
Reviews.Content: What a shame...a great restaurant and exceptional rooms are completely lost to the fact that this is not a hotel. It is a luxury youth hostel nightclub that anyone wishing to actually sleep will greatly regret. I ended up checking out of a very comfortable suite at 11:00PM and leaving to an inferior product at Se Hotel which was at the very least quiet. Go ahead...be lured in...but if the rooftop nightclub is open you will be subjected to a thumping bass drum of hell like you have never imagined. Don't believe this and all the other reviews here stating the same? Give it a go...if you are not driven crazy by the noise you are either deaf or 18.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: hk283
Reviews.Content: Yes, we were warned, but this is basically 3 nightclubs with a hotel built around it. It's pretty noisy. If you're 21-25 and want to do nothing but party, good place to stay. Otherwise, it's loud and the rooms are Euro-styled, with a bath/shower in the middle of the room that leaks. Not an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: luvztravel2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Perfect location in the gas lamp area... service was amazing! Would definitly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vday”
Reviews.Author: lizzlesd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Andaz (formerly the Ivy) for Valentines Day and had a wonderful time. I actually live in downtown SD anyway but wanted to have a little romantic getaway for Vday, even if only for the night. We were lucky to get a hotwire rate of $113 per night, so i thought it was quite a steal. Hotel lobby is very chic and modern- my style, so i thought it was beautiful. Check in was no prob and they served complimentary Evian while I waited. Staff was very pleasant and courteous-- not like some of the reviews i had read on here. Despite our lower rate we did not have a room facing the inside, but instead had a city facing view which i thought was great. As many reviews state, the rooms are pretty small, but given the decor and layout I found them to be very cozy-- great for a weekend or night of romance (all you need is a great bed, right?-- and the hotel did not dissapoint). They had great toiletries and robes as well as complimentary snacks and drinks (pretty rare for such a highly rated place). Definitely caters to adults as there is a "booty kit" with "intimate" items i found to be amusing :) At night you could slightly hear the music from the roof, but not bothersome at all as it didnt wake me from the little sleep i got anyway-- but i am a twenty-something (although not for long) :) Overall rooms were comfy, clean, and beautiful. My favorite part of the stay, however, was the roof top pool. Great decor and great view-- plus its heated (although no jacuzzi) !Despite it being vday, a holiday weekend, and incredibly warm weather for february, it was virtually empty, so we felt like we had the area to ourselves. we ended up lounging around in the cabanas and pool beds even after we checkout. it was just very peaceful and romantic-- not as obnoxious and crowded as it typically was during the summer. Also-- awesome Kobe burger, but of course you'll pay 12 for it! Overall, I highly reccommend. Probably not worth the regular rate since the rooms are small. But given what we paid and the fact that the rooftop was empty, couldnt really ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “worst treatment I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: dasnake87
Reviews.Content: The room, the hotel and the nightclub are very nice, However, if you plan on having people in your room after hours, I suggest you stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excruciatingly loud hotel”
Reviews.Author: athenaert
Reviews.Content: The hotel has three clubs and the techno music permeates the hotel rooms. At 8 pm, it is uncomfortable to not be able to hear our TV in our room because the dance music. At 1:30 am (4:30 am east coast equivalent), we were like lab rats in a sleep deprivation study.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Disappointing, and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: OtekCA
Reviews.Content: Althougth the rooms look nice, we experienced the following problems: 1) The rooms doors are paper thin, and slam closed. We heard doors slamming closed and hallway conversations nearly all night. 2) Walls are thin. We heard guest in the adjacent room talking until 4:00am. Also, we heard people talking, and sirens on the stree outside three floors below. Normally I sleep like a rock, but not at this hotel. 3) The bath tub shown on the web site, was not in my room. No hot bubble for us. 4) The T.V. kept freezing every few minutes when we attempted to watch a movie. 5) No controllable bathroom fan. Hopefully your poop does not stink. 6) No TV guide. 7) The TV Speaker in bathrrom is too loud and can not be truned off. 8) The tiny refrigerator was packed full of drinks for sale. No room for my own stuff. $9 for a bottle of water. 9) No non-valet parking. Make sure you remove all valuables each time you drive your car. 10) Homeless people all around the neighborhood, one-way street maze with potholes. This place is over priced, noisy, and in kind of a dumpy neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, fun party hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoe-Chloe
Reviews.Content: I live about 5 miles from hotel and wasn't positive that this was the right place to celebrate my 35th birthday, but it couldn't have been more perfect. My spouse booked a room (great price, had a friend who works with hotel) for us to have about 20 friends pre-party in for my birthday. We booked a premium room and it was large and well laid out with a sofa, chair, king bed, and additional sitting area on the chest at the end of the bed. The staff was great and super friendly - even when room service was delivered the next morning and the staff person saw all of the empty champagne, liqour and wine bottles, she commented on how she was glad we had so much fun and that everyone needs to party and have a good time. Most of the 20 people were gay and lesbian couples, and we all had a blast and everyone who worked at the hotel was great. Pool was small but heated and I was sad I forgot my suit.

HotelInfo.Name: Andaz San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 600 F Street, Gaslamp Quarter, San Diego, CA 92101
